fast3d.math

Class Vector4d

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.math.Vector4d
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Color

    public class Vector4d
extends java.lang.Object
    a vector4d is a set of 4 double-coordinates, named x, y, z and a
    the vectors dimension determines it's count of coordinates
    a vector can be interpreted as a location or direction in it's 4d universe
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double a
      the coordinate a of the vector
      fourth dimensions coordinate
      double x
      the coordinate x of the vector
      first dimensions coordinate
      double y
      the coordinate y of the vector
      second dimensions coordinate
      double z
      the coordinate z of the vector
      third dimensions coordinate

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vector4d(double x, double y, double z, double a)
      constructs a new vector based on the given coordinates

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Vector4d a()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as a-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      Vector4d add(Vector4d t)
      adds the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      double angleTo(Vector4d v)
      calculates the angle between this and the parameter-vector in radiant
      both vectors are direction-vectors and for that calculation interpreted as arrows laying on the 4d-space-origin
      does not change the parameter
      static Vector4d calculateAverage(Vector4d... vecs)
      the average vector is:
      does not change the parameter
      the center position (if the given vectors were interpreted as positions) the middle-direction (if the given vectors were interpreted as directions)
      Vector4d clone() 
      Vector4d constrain(double min, double max)
      constrains the coordinates to the given range
      if a coordinate is lower than min, it will be set to min
      if a coordinate is higher than max, it will be set to max
      after this method call all coordinates will be within the interval [min,max], including the limits
      Vector4d constrainLength(double min, double max)
      constrains the length to the given range
      if this length is lower than min, it will be scaled to min
      if this length is higher than max, it will be scaled to max
      double distanceTo(Vector4d target)
      calculates the length of the difference vector given by to(target)
      does not change the parameter
      double distanceToSquared(Vector4d target)
      calculates the square of the length of the difference vector given by to(target)
      does not change the parameter
      double dotP(Vector4d v)
      calculates the dot-product of this and the parameter
      does not change both the parameter or this
      static double dotP(Vector4d a, Vector4d b)
      the dot product of two vectors is an double that can represent part of the angle between the parameters
      the dotP is positive if the angle between the vectors is pointed, a negative value otherwise
      if the parameter-vectors are orthogonal, the result will be 0
      it does not matter in which order the parameters are given
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      compares this with the parameter and returns false if the parameter is not of the same type
      does not change the parameter
      int getA()
      casts the a value to int
      double getCoordinate(int dimensionIndex) 
      double[] getCoordinates() 
      int getDimension()
      will always return 4
      returns the length of the array given by getCoordinates();
      static double getRatio(Vector4d a, Vector4d b)
      returns the ratio between the two given parallel vectors or Double.NaN if they are not parallel
      if given vectors a and b the ratio is defined as:
      a = ratio * b so that ratio = a / b;
      int getX()
      casts the x value to int
      int getY()
      casts the y value to int
      int getZ()
      casts the z value to int
      Vector4d invert()
      inverts this vector
      this will point in the opposite direction, but with the same length
      static boolean isFinite(Vector4d v)
      checks whether the given vector is not null and all it's coordinates are finite
      boolean isNormalized() 
      boolean isParallel(Vector4d v)
      checks, whether the parameter-vector has the same direction
      it may have another length
      does not change the parameter
      boolean isSameOrientated(Vector4d v)
      checks, whether the parameter-vector has the same direction and orientation
      it may have another length
      does not change the parameter
      boolean isZero()
      checks all coordinates to be 0d
      double length()
      calculates the length of the vector as a n-dimensional arrow
      double lengthSquared()
      calculates the squared length of the vector as a n-dimensional arrow
      faster than length()
      Vector4d multiply(Vector4d t)
      multiplies the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector4d normalize()
      scales the vector to the length 1
      fails (does nothing than) for the zero-vector
      static Vector4d one() 
      static Vector4d random() 
      Vector4d scale(double k)
      enlarges the vector by k, it's direction will be constant
      for k between 0 and 1, the vector will be shortened
      for negative k the vector will be inverted and then enlarged by positive k
      Vector4d scaleTo(double length)
      scales this vector to the length of the parameter-vector, but will not change this direction
      Vector4d scaleTo(Vector4d compare)
      scales this vector to the length of the parameter-vector, but will not change this direction
      the parameter will not be changed
      Vector4d set(double x, double y, double z, double a)
      copies the coordinates of the parameter to this
      Vector4d set(Vector4d t)
      copies the coordinates of the parameter to this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector4d setCoordinates(double[] vec)
      counterpart to getCoordinates
      sets the coordinates of this to x=[0], y=[1], z=[2], a=[3]
      Vector4d setToZero()
      sets all coordinates to 0
      Vector4d sub(Vector4d t)
      subtracts the coordinates of the parameter from the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector4d to(Vector4d t)
      does not change the parameter
      java.lang.String toRoundedString(int decimalPlace)
      to display the vector in an user-appropriate form with x digits after the comma
      for negative parameters, the coordinates will be displayed rounded.
      java.lang.String toString() 
      static Vector4d x()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as x-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      static Vector4d y()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as y-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      static Vector4d z()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as z-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      static Vector4d zero()

      • toRoundedString

        public java.lang.String toRoundedString(int decimalPlace)
        to display the vector in an user-appropriate form with x digits after the comma
        for negative parameters, the coordinates will be displayed rounded.
        this will not be changed
        Parameters:
        decimalPlace - digits to display after comma
        Returns:
        an readable string-representation of the coordinates

      • scale

        public Vector4d scale(double k)
        enlarges the vector by k, it's direction will be constant
        for k between 0 and 1, the vector will be shortened
        for negative k the vector will be inverted and then enlarged by positive k
        Parameters:
        k - factor to enlarge
        Returns:
        a this-reference

      • isParallel

        public boolean isParallel(Vector4d v)
        checks, whether the parameter-vector has the same direction
        it may have another length
        does not change the parameter
        Parameters:
        v - the Vector to check
        Returns:
        true if the parameter-vector has the same direction

      • getRatio

        public static double getRatio(Vector4d a,
                              Vector4d b)
        returns the ratio between the two given parallel vectors or Double.NaN if they are not parallel
        if given vectors a and b the ratio is defined as:
        a = ratio * b so that ratio = a / b;
        Parameters:
        a - the dividend
        b - the divisor
        Returns:
        the ratio

      • isSameOrientated

        public boolean isSameOrientated(Vector4d v)
        checks, whether the parameter-vector has the same direction and orientation
        it may have another length
        does not change the parameter
        Parameters:
        v - the Vector to check
        Returns:
        true if the parameter-vector has the same direction and is not inverted

      • dotP

        public double dotP(Vector4d v)
        calculates the dot-product of this and the parameter
        does not change both the parameter or this
        Parameters:
        v - the vector to calculate the dot-product with
        Returns:
        the dot-product between this and the parameter

      • dotP

        public static double dotP(Vector4d a,
                          Vector4d b)
        the dot product of two vectors is an double that can represent part of the angle between the parameters
        the dotP is positive if the angle between the vectors is pointed, a negative value otherwise
        if the parameter-vectors are orthogonal, the result will be 0
        it does not matter in which order the parameters are given
        Parameters:
        a - the first vector
        b - the second vector
        Returns:
        the dot product of the vectors

      • invert

        public Vector4d invert()
        inverts this vector
        this will point in the opposite direction, but with the same length
        Returns:
        a this-reference

      • angleTo

        public double angleTo(Vector4d v)
        calculates the angle between this and the parameter-vector in radiant
        both vectors are direction-vectors and for that calculation interpreted as arrows laying on the 4d-space-origin
        does not change the parameter
        Parameters:
        v - the vector to calculate the angle of this to
        Returns:
        the radiant-angle to the parameter-vector

      • isZero

        public boolean isZero()
        checks all coordinates to be 0d
        Returns:
        true if so, false otherwise

      • isNormalized

        public boolean isNormalized()
        Returns:
        true if the length of this is 1d, false otherwise

      • calculateAverage

        public static Vector4d calculateAverage(Vector4d... vecs)
        the average vector is:
        does not change the parameter
        • the center position (if the given vectors were interpreted as positions)
        • the middle-direction (if the given vectors were interpreted as directions)
        Parameters:
        vecs - all vectors to calculate the average one
        Returns:
        the average vector of all given ones

      • zero

        public static Vector4d zero()
        Returns:
        an independent vector where all coordinates are 0d

      • constrain

        public Vector4d constrain(double min,
                          double max)
        constrains the coordinates to the given range
        if a coordinate is lower than min, it will be set to min
        if a coordinate is higher than max, it will be set to max
        after this method call all coordinates will be within the interval [min,max], including the limits
        Parameters:
        min - the lower-limit
        max - the upper-limit
        Returns:
        a this reference

      • constrainLength

        public Vector4d constrainLength(double min,
                                double max)
        constrains the length to the given range
        if this length is lower than min, it will be scaled to min
        if this length is higher than max, it will be scaled to max
        Parameters:
        min - the lower-limit
        max - the upper-limit
        Returns:
        a this reference

      • x

        public static Vector4d x()
        creates an independent vector with 1 as x-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
        Returns:
        a vector with x=1, other coordinates = 0

        public static Vector4d a()

        Returns:
        a vector with a=1, other coordinates = 0

        public static boolean isFinite(Vector4d v)
        checks whether the given vector is not null and all it's coordinates are finite
        Parameters:
        v - the vector to check
        Returns:
        whether the vector can be considered usable in general case
